metadata.title: CVE-2023-5178 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drivers/nvme/target/tcp.c` in`nvmet_tcp_free_crypto` due to a logical bug in the NVMe/TCP subsystem inthe Linux kernel. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause ause-after-free and double-free problem, which may permit remote codeexecution or lead to local privilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
